for training the machine. If the machine makes a right decision, the machine gets a positive point.
If it makes a wrong decision, it gets a negative point for it. So repeating the process again and
again, the machine learns it. So this process is of reinforcement learning. So let's take the
example of a self-driving car over here. So initially when the car was trained, so the car didn't know
what way to choose. Okay. So what it did, it made an action, but the action it performed was wrong.
So it got a penalty of minus 50 points for that. So from the next time, car realized that what it
did earlier was wrong and it updated its policy and then it errates the process. Okay. So this is
reinforcement learning. So let me just explain you reinforcement learning with the concept of
how Pavlo trained his dog using reinforcement learning. So this is a famous example of how Pavlo
trained his dog using reinforcement learning. So it's like initially Pavlo gave food to the dog. So
in response to the food, the dog started salivating. Okay. This was before conditioning. Then in the
next phase, what he did, he just rang a bell for which the dog did not respond anything. Okay.
Then the third phase, what he did, he rang the bell and then gave him the food. So seeing the food,
the dog started salivating again. Then after that, he repeated this third step again and again
and again until the dog learned it. Then after conditioning, whenever Pavlo used to rang the bell,
the dog started salivating. He understood that whenever the bell is going to ring, his master is
going to give him the food. So this is how Pavlo trained his dog using reinforcement learning.
Okay. One of the application or the use case of reinforcement learning is self-driving car.

All the data the car collects need to be analyzed to determine the best course of action.
